ModuleDescription:
This module is an introduction to electromagnetics (EM) for
electrical engineers. Electromagnetics is essential in all
disciplines of electrical engineering. At the end of this
module, students will be able to explain many physical
phenomena in everyday life, such as electricity energy
transmission, wave reflection/transmission, and the impact
of skin depth on wave propagation. Topics covered
include: static electric fields, static magnetic fields, timevarying
fields, electromagnetic waves, transmission lines
and antennas.
